translation.en: Phones had to be turned off inside the courtroom.
translation.ko: 법정 내에서는 소지 중인 휴대폰 전원을 꺼주세요

translation.en: They'll be turned on as soon as the judge finishes reading,
translation.ko: 법정 내에서는 소지 중인 휴대폰 전원을 꺼주세요 판사가 판결문 낭독을 마치면 다시 전원을 켜도 좋습니다

translation.en: and then we'll learn the sentence.
translation.ko: 판사가 판결문 낭독을 마치면 다시 전원을 켜도 좋습니다 판결문 낭독 후에 형기가 밝혀지겠습니다

translation.en: [man] Attention!
The news is that Raffaele Sollecito
and Amanda Knox have been exonerated.
-[woman gasps] Oh, my God! What? -[man] Holy shit!
I know! This is crazy!
Raffaele?
[in Italian] We're free!
How are you?
I'm so happy for you. I'm so happy for us.
Much love and we'll talk soon.
Bye.
-[woman 1 in English] Oh, my God. -[woman 2] Oh, my God!
[Arlene Kercher] The first reaction was one of surprise. Uh...
They've had two convictions...
um...
and they've had two acquittals now.
It seems an awful long time to get such a strange verdict.
translation.ko: 그토록 오래 기다렸는데 이상한 판결이 나왔어요

translation.en: Um, eight years.
So it's sort of bringing everything into disrepute.
[Nick] I think at the end of the day, you have to point the finger
translation.ko: 결국 생각해보면 정말 비난해야 할 건

translation.en: at the police, really, and the prosecution.
They made some really heinous errors
and they got fixated on some wild theories that they were absolutely obsessed with.
translation.ko: 끔찍한 실수를 저질렀을 뿐 아니라 자신들의 가설에 집착해 진실을 무시했으니까요 "메러디스 부두교 의식의 희생자"

translation.en: I know people keep saying "Trial by media, trial by media," but...
I don't buy that.
Maybe 'cause I'm a journalist so I don't go for that, but... [chuckles]
translation.ko: 물론 언론인으로서 그런 점도 있겠지만 "메러디스 사건 용의자 6명 가능성"

translation.en: I think now, looking back, some of the information that came out
translation.ko: 사건 당시 유출된 사건 관련 일부 정보는

translation.en: was just crazy, really, and just completely made up.
translation.ko: 완전히 날조된 것으로 진실과 동떨어져 있었죠 "아만다 녹스, 종교적 살인"

translation.en: But, hey, what are we supposed to do, you know?
We are journalists and we are reporting what we are being told.
translation.ko: 언론인의 본분은 들은 대로 보고하는 겁니다

translation.en: It's not as if I can say, "Right, hold on a minute.
I just wanna double check that myself in some other way."
I mean, goodness knows how.
And then I let my rival get in there first before me,
and then, hey, I've lost a scoop.
It doesn't work like that. Not in the news game.
[Giuliano in Italian] During the trial there was a woman who...
translation.ko: 재판이 진행되던 중 한 여성이 저를 보고

translation.en: She said I was the devil.
[in English] "You are evil."
[in Italian] I can say that I've made mistakes,
even things that I have had to confess,
translation.ko: 자잘한 실수가 아닌 죄를 저지른 적도 있어요

translation.en: but we are all between good and evil.
translation.ko: 하지만 사람은 누구나 선과 악의 기로에 있죠

translation.en: It's in our human nature.
Amanda and Sollecito, if they are innocent,
translation.ko: 만약 아만다와 라파엘레가 정말 무죄였다고 하면

translation.en: I hope they're able to forget the suffering that they've endured.
translation.ko: 만약 아만다와 라파엘레가 정말 무죄였다고 하면 두 사람이 고통을 잊고 다시 시작하기를 바랍니다

translation.en: If they're guilty, if earthly justice didn't get to them,
translation.ko: 하지만 죄가 있었는데 재판에서 밝혀지지 않았다면

translation.en: I hope they own their guilt,
translation.ko: 하지만 죄가 있었는데 재판에서 밝혀지지 않았다면 그 죄책감까지 부인하지는 않기를 빌어요

translation.en: because I know that life ends with a final trial.
translation.ko: 그 죄책감까지 부인하지는 않기를 빌어요 어차피 사람은 다 죽고 심판받게 되니까요

translation.en: A trial with no appeals, no second chances, and no revisions.
translation.ko: 어차피 사람은 다 죽고 심판받게 되니까요 하늘의 법정에는 상소심도 재심도 존재하지 않죠

translation.en: [Amanda] I think people love monsters.
And so when they get the chance, they want to see them.
translation.ko: 그래서 기회만 생기면 직접 보려고 달려들죠

translation.en: It's people projecting their fears.
They want the reassurance that...
they know who the bad people are, and it's not them.
translation.ko: 자신은 악인이 아니라는 그런 위안 말이에요

translation.en: So maybe that's what it is.
We're all afraid.
And fear makes people crazy.
